title.narrative: Teacher Training for Better Primary Education in Manica Province Central Mozambique

description.narrative: The project will contribute to the improvement of the quality of primary education in Manica province through pre-service training of 90 teachers (young men and women) improving the learning environment and the teaching quality of the Teacher Training Coll ege (Escola de Professores do Futuro EPF) in Chimoio to successfully implement the new 3 year teacher training program. It will support the future graduates to become part of the Graduated Teachers Network which aims to be a forum for teachers to support e ach other in their profession as teachers of rural primary schools. The 90 qualified teachers will work mainly in the districts of the Manica Province and that will impact on 11.000 primary school pupils yearly who will receive a more child centered educat ion.The EPF students will receive training on the following main topics: child-centered education annual teaching and lesson plans active learning time management preparation of a lesson life skills in primary education early reading and writing skills bil ingual education involvement of parents gender equality integration methods school management etc. The students will be coached by their teachers to develop a close relationship with selected primary schools in the province where they will initiate their t eaching practice in the second year of the training course.The project aims at the improvement of the quality of primary school education and creation of pupil friendly environment n primary schools. In the long term perspective the performance of children at school will improve especially in terms of early reading and writing skills the dropout rates will decrease and completion rates from grade to grade will increase. The children will enter the adult life equipped with more skills than their parents. A p roper educational base for the children paves their way out of poverty. Included in the teacher training program is a component of community development: the students will carry out different activities including adult literacy training agriculture and inc ome generation projects in the nearby communities.In all its components the project puts emphasis on the participation of women and girls in education economic activity and decision making. The capacity of both UFF and its partner for mainstreaming disabil ity issues will be strengthened during the project through cooperation with Fidida (Finnish Disabled People?s International Development Association).
